roleset.name: set one thing atop another
roleset.note: STACK-V NOTES: Frames file for 'stack' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet class spray-9.7-2, other framed members include hang, seed. Comparison with 'set'. (from stack.01-v predicate notes)

role.descr: the other thing arg1 istacked onto, destination

example.name: stack on
example.text: But in recent years, the market has moved toward less expensive ``mini-component'' sets, miniaturized amplifiers and receivers and software players that *trace*-1 could be stacked *trace*-1 on top of each other.
example.arg: that -> miniaturized amplifiers and receivers and software players

example.name: stack against
example.text: ``Small investors are absolutely dismayed that Wall Street is stacking the deck against them, and these wide swings are scaring them to death,'' says Raymond A. Mason, chairman of regional broker Legg Mason Inc. in Baltimore.

example.name: unaccusative
example.text: It wasn't clear how the ownership would stack up under the new plan, but employees would keep more than 50%.

example.name: big pile
example.text: John stacked up all his dirty dishes.
